inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{91}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since $\angle PAB$ and $\angle BAC$ are supplementary, $\angle BAC = 180^{\circ} - x^\circ$.  Since the three angles of a triangle add up to $ 180^{\circ} $, we have $\angle ACB = 180^{\circ} - 90^{\circ} - (180^{\circ} - x^\circ) = x^\circ - 90^{\circ}$.  Thus, $M + N = \boxed{-89}$.
